title: CREC Steve Zwinger: Organic wheat/flax intercropping

tasks.task: Physical tasks related to the wheat-flax intercrop trial at the NDSU Carrington Research Extension Center's organic tour.
subtasks: Observing the wheat flax intercrop trial.
Identifying the two wheat varieties (FBC Dillon and Glen Wheat) and the flax variety (Omega Flax and N.D. Hammond).
Noting the seeding rates for each crop (1.6 million pure live seed per acre for wheat, 60 pounds per acre for flax).
Recognizing the environmental conditions affecting the trial (drought and previous cover crop).
Understanding the historical context of wheat-flax intercropping (practiced in the Dakotas since the 1920s but unclear economic benefits in early studies).
Considering the potential benefits of intercropping (weed control, yield improvement) in organic systems.
Acknowledging the need for further research to optimize intercropping practices and seed rates for organic production.
